query: dialog with R's persona: persona: i recently moved to this country. i just moved into my first home. a already have a step children. i'm expecting triplets in three months. context:  Q: yes i'm a true american who loves pizza . R: i do not have any but charlie my puppy enjoys it . Q: wow ! that many kids wouldn't fit in my honda civic . R: <extra_id_0>
answers: that is a nice car . i drive an impala
generation: i bet. i just moved to the country, and i'm loving it.

passages.title: Samantha is Self-Sufficient
passages.text: My dad always taught me how to be self-sufficient. I even taught myself how to change a tyre on a car. One day my tyre blew while I was driving. I was able to properly change my tyre. I was very grateful to be able to get home safely.

passages.title: Someday I'll come Home
passages.text: I left my son and girlfriend late in the fall of 1978. After I made it to the other side of the country, I went to the beach. I sat on the shore and drank what was left of my flask. Every year on his birthday, I return to that beach and get drunk. Through tears I tell the ocean that someday I will come home.

passages.title: Popped inner tube
passages.text: I was riding my bike to my friends' house. Suddenly, I felt a pop and my bike stopped working. I took the bike home and checked out the problem. I went to the store and bought the tube to fix the tyre. I went home and fixed my bike and went for a ride.

passages.title: Ronald Goes Bowling
passages.text: I want to think of something to do with my friends. I decided that I would like to go bowling with them. They go to the local bowling alley in the afternoon. I bowl very well. I am happy that I found something to do with my friends.

passages.title: Bill Goes to Graduate School
passages.text: I decide that I want to pursue a master's degree after college. While my friends are all looking for jobs, I am applying for a school. At first I worried that I was making the wrong decision. However, when I get to graduate school, I feel great. I am proud that I will soon have a master's degree.

passages.title: Gas Bill
passages.text: My mom told me that the family had a very high gas bill. They could not afford bills that high, so changes would be made. I was told that the heat was going to be lowered. From now on I would have to wear warm clothes around the house. I was unhappy, but I understood.
